title: Creative Maternity Photography: Fashion-Inspired Red Monochromatic Shoot
summary: Portrait photographer Lindsay Adler demonstrates how to elevate a maternity photoshoot by treating it like a fashion editorial. She details a monochromatic red concept, explains posing strategies for a six-month pregnancy, and builds a three-light setup to create definition and separation.

steps.action: Introduction to the concept: treating maternity sessions like fashion shoots with full styling.
Building the set using a red shag carpet and a matching red background.
steps.tool: Red Shag Carpet, Savage Universal Primary Red Background

steps.action: Styling the subject with a red maternity dress and red lipstick for a monochromatic look.
Posing strategy: Selecting a reclining pose to better emphasize a smaller (6-month) baby bump.
Setting up the Main Light: A 3ft Octa box with a grid positioned high to contour the face and stomach.
Adding Rim Lights: Two 1x4ft strip softboxes with grids added to the sides/back to separate the red subject from the red background.
Shooting the session using a versatile zoom lens and varying camera angles.

key_takeaways: Treating maternity shoots with fashion styling (hair, makeup, wardrobe) creates unique, high-end results.
For subjects earlier in their pregnancy (e.g., 6 months), reclining poses and directional lighting help define the bump better than standing poses.
When shooting a subject wearing the same color as the background (monochromatic), rim lighting is essential to create separation.
Using grids on softboxes controls light spill, keeping the background saturated and the lighting dramatic.
